cards.name: Angelic Blessing
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Only the warrior who can admit mortal weakness will be bolstered by immortal strength.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Angelic Protector
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Angelic Protector becomes the target of a spell or ability, Angelic Protector gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"My family sheltered in her light, the dark was content to wait."
—Crovax

rulings.text: The ability triggers when Angelic Protector is chosen as a target for a spell or ability. The Protectors ability will be put on the stack above that spell or ability, and so resolve first.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Angelic Protector becomes the target of a spell or ability, Angelic Protector gets +0/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Armor Sliver
cards.text: All Sliver creatures have "{2}: This creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn."
cards.flavor:
Hanna: "We must learn how they protect each other."
Mirri: "After they're done trying to kill us, all right?"

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn't provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it's no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.originalText: All Sliver creatures have "{2}: This creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn."

cards.name: Armored Pegasus
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"I always charge a little extra to take on a pegasus. They fly like eagles, kick like mules, and hide like hermits."
—Tahli en-Dal, bounty hunter
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Avenging Angel
cards.text:
Flying
When Avenging Angel dies, you may put it on top of its owner's library.

rulings.text: This has been restored as a triggered ability that triggers when it is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, rather than a replacement effect. The Angel does go to the graveyard, and will trigger any other abilities that look for this event.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Avenging Angel dies, you may put it on top of its owner's library.

cards.name: Bandage
cards.text:
Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Takara shook with guilt. She knew the last image her father had seen was her sword flashing toward him.

rulings.text: You draw the card when Bandage resolves, not when the damage is actually prevented.

cards.originalText:
Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Cataclysm
cards.text: Each player chooses from among the permanents they control an artifact, a creature, an enchantment, and a land, then sacrifices the rest.
cards.flavor: The Weatherlight dragged the Predator behind it, the cradle hauling the casket.

rulings.text: If you control a permanent with more than one type, you can choose that same permanent for more than one of the choices if you want to. This makes it possible to select an artifact creature as both your artifact and creature, and then select a land and thereby keep only two cards.

If you control a permanent with more than one type, you can choose that permanent to be the representative of either type. This makes it possible to have more than one creature (or other permanent type) on the battlefield. For example, if you select a creature for your creature and an artifact creature for your artifact, you get to keep both of these creatures.
The permanents to save are chosen on resolution. You do not choose them when casting the spell.
The current player makes their choices before the other player. After both players make choices, all the sacrifices are done simultaneously.
Each permanent not chosen by a player will be sacrificed. If a permanent has none of the listed types (for example, a Planeswalker with no other types), it can't be chosen.

cards.originalText: Each player chooses from among the permanents he or she controls an artifact, a creature, an enchantment, and a land, then sacrifices the rest.

cards.name: Charging Paladin
cards.text: Whenever Charging Paladin attacks, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Hope shall be the blade that severs our bonds."
cards.originalText: Whenever Charging Paladin attacks, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Conviction
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+3.
{W}: Return Conviction to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: It was not the minotaur's shoulders but his soul that bore the heaviest weight.

rulings.text: Players don't have priority to cast spells and activate abilities between combat damage being assigned and being dealt. This means that if you want to return Conviction to its owner's hand before combat damage is dealt, you must do so before combat damage is assigned (and the creature will no longer get +1/+3).

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+3.
{W}: Return Conviction to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Disenchant
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor: The swarm seemed unmoved by the artificial slivers' destruction. "They clearly were not the leaders," Hanna cursed. "I guess we'll have to do this the hard way."

rulings.text: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Exalted Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Exalted Dragon can't attack unless you sacrifice a land. (This cost is paid as attackers are declared.)
cards.flavor: If dragons excel at anything more than vanity, it is greed.

rulings.text: You have to sacrifice a land at the time you declare this creature as an attacker if you want it to attack. This is additive with any other attack costs.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Exalted Dragon can't attack unless you sacrifice a land. (This cost is paid as attackers are declared.)

cards.name: Field of Souls
cards.text: Whenever a nontoken creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.

rulings.text: A creature card that you own but don't control will be put into your graveyard if that creature dies, and Field of Souls's ability will trigger.

cards.originalText: Whenever a nontoken creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Gallantry
cards.text:
Target blocking creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Forgive me," Mirri whispered. "I thought you a burden, and you saved my life." Hanna quietly accepted the apology.
cards.originalText:
Target blocking creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Gerrard's Battle Cry
cards.text: {2}{W}: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Gerrard grinned and drew his sword. "This won't be a fair fight," he called to his crew. "They should have brought a second ship!"
cards.originalText: {2}{W}: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Humility
cards.text: All creatures lose all abilities and have base power and toughness 1/1.
cards.flavor:
"One cannot cleanse the wounds of failure."
—Karn, silver golem

rulings.text: With a Humility and two Opalescences on the battlefield, if Humility has the latest timestamp, then all creatures are 1/1 with no abilities. If the timestamp order is Opalescence, Humility, Opalescence, the second Opalescence is 1/1, and the Humility and first Opalescence are 4/4. If Humility has the earliest timestamp, then everything is 4/4.
Removes all creature abilities. This includes mana abilities. Animated lands will also lose the ability to tap for mana.

This is the current interaction between Humility and Opalescence: The type-changing effect applies at layer 4, but the rest happens in the applicable layers. The rest of it will apply even if the permanent loses its ability before it's finished applying. So if Opalescence, Humility, and Worship are on the battlefield and Opalescence entered the battlefield before Humility, the following is true: Layer 4: Humility and Worship each become creatures that are still enchantments. (Opalescence). Layer 6: Humility and Worship each lose their abilities. (Humility) Layer 7b: Humility becomes 4/4 and Worship becomes 4/4. (Opalescence). Humility becomes 1/1 and Worship becomes 1/1 (Humility). But if Humility entered the battlefield before Opalescence, the following is true: Layer 4: Humility and Worship each become creatures that are still enchantments (Opalescence). Layer 6: Humility and Worship each lose their abilities (Humility). Layer 7b: Humility becomes 1/1 and Worship becomes 1/1 (Humility). Humility becomes 4/4 and Worship becomes 4/4 (Opalescence).

You apply power/toughness changing effects in a series of sublayers in the following order: (a) effects from characteristic-defining abilities; (b) effects that set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (c) effects that modify power and/or toughness but don't set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (d) changes from counters; (e) effects that switch a creature's power and toughness. This card's effect is always applied in (b), which means that effects applied in sublayer (c), (d), or (e) will not be overwritten; they will be applied to the new value.

cards.originalText: All creatures lose all abilities and have base power and toughness 1/1.

cards.flavor: The true treasure no thief can touch.

rulings.text: You can use the ability multiple times so it can block more than two creatures.

cards.name: Smite
cards.text: Destroy target blocked creature.
cards.flavor:

—Gerrard, to Volrath

rulings.text: A "blocked creature" is an attacking creature that has been blocked by a creature this combat, or has become blocked as the result of a spell or ability this combat. Unless the attacking creature leaves combat, it continues to be a blocked creature through the end of combat step, even if the creature or creatures that blocked it are no longer on the battlefield or have otherwise left combat by then.

cards.originalText: Destroy target blocked creature.

cards.name: Curiosity
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: All Mirri wanted to do was rest, but she couldn't ignore a nagging suspicion as she followed Crovax's skulking form.

rulings.text: "You" refers to the controller of Curiosity, which may be different from the controller of the enchanted creature. "An opponent" refers to an opponent of Curiosity's controller.
Any damage dealt by the enchanted creature to an opponent will cause Curiosity to trigger, not just combat damage.
Curiosity doesn't trigger if the enchanted creature deals damage to a planeswalker controlled by an opponent.
You draw one card each time the enchanted creature deals damage to an opponent, no matter how much damage it deals or whether it was dealt in combat.
If this Aura enchants an opponent's creature, you won't draw a card when that creature damages you. The creature has to deal damage to one of your opponents for the ability to trigger.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Legacy's Allure
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a treasure counter on Legacy's Allure.
Sacrifice Legacy's Allure: Gain control of target creature with power less than or equal to the number of treasure counters on Legacy's Allure. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

rulings.text: The "power less than or equal to the number of treasure counters on this card" restriction is a targeting restriction and will be checked on resolution in addition to on announcement. If the creature's power changes to be greater than this before the effect resolves, then the Legacy's Allure triggered ability doesn't resolve, but the card stays in the graveyard.

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a treasure counter on Legacy's Allure.
Sacrifice Legacy's Allure: Gain control of target creature with power less than or equal to the number of treasure counters on Legacy's Allure.

cards.name: Legerdemain
cards.text: Exchange control of target artifact or creature and another target permanent that shares one of those types with it. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
cards.flavor: Squee tucked the warm ball in his pocket and slipped a pebble in its place. "Glok," he mumbled, and hid.

rulings.text: You can't cast Legerdemain unless both targets share a type at that time. It will also check to make sure they share a type as it resolves. If they no longer do so, the exchange will not occur.

cards.originalText: Exchange control of target artifact or creature and another target permanent that shares one of those types with it.

rulings.text: You can't do anything in between drawing a card and discarding a card, including casting or cycling the card you drew.

cards.originalText: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.

cards.name: Mnemonic Sliver
cards.text: All Slivers have "{2}, Sacrifice this permanent: Draw a card."
cards.flavor:
"A jigsaw puzzle that lives, breeds, and thinks."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn't provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it's no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.originalText: All Slivers have "{2}, Sacrifice this permanent: Draw a card."

cards.name: Rootwater Hunter
cards.text: {T}: Rootwater Hunter deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"Bitter water, vicious wave;
Shadow-cold shallows, root-made maze.
Home's angry embrace."
—Rootwater Saga
cards.originalText: {T}: Rootwater Hunter deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Scrivener
cards.text: When Scrivener enters the battlefield, you may return target instant card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor:
"History is a potent weapon."
—Karn, silver golem
cards.originalText: When Scrivener enters the battlefield, you may return target instant card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Sea Monster
cards.text: Sea Monster can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
cards.flavor: Water is life. Or perhaps it is just something to wash it down with.
cards.originalText: Sea Monster can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

cards.name: Shadow Rift
cards.text:
Target creature gains shadow until end of turn. (It can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Draw a card.
cards.originalText:
Target creature gains shadow until end of turn. (It can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Draw a card.

cards.name: Sift
cards.text: Draw three cards, then discard a card.
cards.flavor:
"Twice I have let the Legacy slip away. Never again."
—Karn, silver golem
cards.originalText: Draw three cards, then discard a card.

cards.name: Silver Wyvern
cards.text:
Flying
{U}: Change the target of target spell or ability that targets only Silver Wyvern. The new target must be a creature.

rulings.text: You must pick a legal target when redirecting the spell or ability.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{U}: Change the target of target spell or ability that targets only Silver Wyvern. The new target must be a creature.

cards.name: Spell Blast
cards.text: Counter target spell with converted mana cost X. (For example, if that spell's mana cost is {3}{U}{U}, X is 5.)
cards.flavor: Call it the thinking mage's version of brute force.

rulings.text: Alternative costs, additional costs, cost increases, and cost reductions don't affect a spell's converted mana cost.

If the target spell has {X} in its mana cost, include the value chosen for that X when determining the value of the {X} in Spell Blast's mana cost. For example, if you wish to counter Volcanic Geyser (a spell with mana cost {X}{R}{R}) whose X is 7, you'll need to choose 9 for Spell Blast's X and pay {9}{U}.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell with converted mana cost X.

cards.name: Thalakos Drifters
cards.text: Discard a card: Thalakos Drifters gains shadow until end of turn. (It can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
cards.flavor: They drift in and out of shadow and ever on toward madness.

rulings.text: The reminder text is only accurate when this card has Shadow.

cards.originalText: Discard a card: Thalakos Drifters gains shadow until end of turn. (It can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)

cards.text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor:
"Gone today, here tomorrow."
—Ertai, wizard adept
cards.originalText: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.

cards.name: Time Warp
cards.text: Target player takes an extra turn after this one.
cards.flavor:
"Let's do it again!"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand

rulings.text: If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

cards.originalText: Target player takes an extra turn after this one.

cards.name: Tradewind Rider
cards.text:
Flying
{T}, Tap two untapped creatures you control: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: It is said that the wind will blow the world past if you wait long enough.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}, Tap two untapped creatures you control: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Twitch
cards.text:
You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Battles are won in nuance.

rulings.text: If the targeted permanent is an illegal target by the time Twitch resolves, the entire spell doesn't resolve. You don't draw a card.

cards.originalText:
You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Volrath's Curse
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated. That creature's controller may sacrifice a permanent for that player to ignore this effect until end of turn.
{1}{U}: Return Volrath's Curse to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: If the creature this card is on is sacrificed to this card, this card is put into the graveyard before the ability to unsummon it can be used.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated. That creature's controller may sacrifice a permanent for that player to ignore this effect until end of turn.
{1}{U}: Return Volrath's Curse to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Wind Drake
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Orim regarded Gerrard coolly. "You are like the drake," she said, her expression unchanging. "It works hard to maintain its position, but to us it seems to glide along effortlessly. You must do the same."
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.text: All Sliver creatures have flying.
cards.flavor:
"Everything around here has cut a deal with gravity."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn't provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it's no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.originalText: All Sliver creatures have flying.

cards.name: Cannibalize
cards.text: Choose two target creatures controlled by the same player. Exile one of those creatures and put two +1/+1 counters on the other.
cards.flavor: "Mine."

rulings.text: You choose the two target creatures during announcement. You choose which gets the counters and which is to get exiled on resolution.

cards.originalText: Choose two target creatures controlled by the same player. Exile one of those creatures and put two +1/+1 counters on the other.

cards.name: Carnophage
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, tap Carnophage unless you pay 1 life.
cards.flavor: Eating is all it knows.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, tap Carnophage unless you pay 1 life.

cards.name: Clot Sliver
cards.text: All Slivers have "{2}: Regenerate this permanent."
cards.flavor:
"One would think I would be accustomed to unexpected returns."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn't provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it's no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.originalText: All Slivers have "{2}: Regenerate this permanent."

cards.name: Coercion
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor:
"There's very little that escapes me, Greven. And you will escape very little if you fail."
—Volrath
cards.originalText: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Coffin Queen
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Coffin Queen during your untap step.
{2}{B}, {T}: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. When Coffin Queen becomes untapped or you lose control of Coffin Queen, exile that creature.

rulings.text: If the creature put onto the battlefield leaves the battlefield, the tracking effect ends and the creature will no longer be exiled if something happens to the Coffin Queen.

If the creature put onto the battlefield phases out, the tracking effect continues when it phases back in if the Coffin Queen is still on the battlefield. If the Queen left the battlefield while the creature was phased out, the creature phases in as normal.

If Coffin Queen leaves the battlefield before its ability resolves, the delayed trigger condition can never be fulfilled, so the creature will not be exiled. If Coffin Queen is untapped when its ability resolves, the creature will not be exiled until the next time Coffin Queen becomes untapped.

cards.originalText:
You may choose not to untap Coffin Queen during your untap step.
{2}{B}, {T}: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. When Coffin Queen becomes untapped or you lose control of Coffin Queen, exile that creature.

cards.name: Commander Greven il-Vec
cards.text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
When Commander Greven il-Vec enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.
cards.flavor: "Rage is the only freedom left to me."
cards.originalText:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
When Commander Greven il-Vec enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.

cards.name: Corpse Dance
cards.text:
Buyback {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Return the top creature card of your graveyard to the battlefield. That creature gains haste until end of turn. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.

rulings.text: Corpse Dance only exiles the card if the card is still on the battlefield at the beginning of the end step.
The effect only grants Haste until the end of the current turn. If the creature somehow manages to stick around until a later turn, it will no longer have Haste.

cards.originalText:
Buyback {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Return the top creature card of your graveyard to the battlefield. That creature gains haste until end of turn. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Crovax the Cursed
cards.text:
Crovax the Cursed enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice a creature. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on Crovax. If you don't, remove a +1/+1 counter from Crovax.
{B}: Crovax gains flying until end of turn.

rulings.text: Crovax can sacrifice itself to its upkeep triggered ability.
You can only sacrifice one creature to it each turn.
If you choose not to sacrifice a creature and he has no +1/+1 counters, then nothing bad happens. Note that some other effect must be keeping him alive if he has no counters.

cards.originalText:
Crovax the Cursed enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice a creature. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on Crovax. If you don't, remove a +1/+1 counter from Crovax.
{B}: Crovax gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Death Pits of Rath
cards.text: Whenever a creature is dealt damage, destroy it. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: As the sludge below began to shift and take shapes, Gerrard turned from the railing to Orim. "I suppose," he said, "it's a little too late for prayer, isn't it?"
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature is dealt damage, destroy it. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Death Stroke
cards.text: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.flavor: For a sharp second, Selenia froze, and Crovax's blade found home. As the angel shattered like glass, Crovax felt his mind collapse—the curse had been fulfilled.
cards.originalText: Destroy target tapped creature.
